title: Maintenance Supervisor 1 - SUNY Maritime College
description:
**Location:** Bronx, NY **Category:** Service, Construction, Maintenance & Skilled Trades **Posted On:** Mon Sep 23 2024 **Job Description:**  

  

SUNY Maritime College is looking for a new team member to join The Facilities Department as Maintenance Supervisor 1. With almost 1600 students, over 800,000 square feet of actively maintained space and approximately 6000 work orders done annually. Modernization of a campus that was established in 1874 has been no easy feat. With upgrades to Health and safety, Fire and life, lighting, security. This position supervises and provides technical direction to the building maintenance program. Candidate will review work requests, estimates materials, labor needs, and costs. Candidate will utilize the work order system to ensure the proper scheduling, planning and availability of fiscal and material resources and tracking of completed work and trends. The candidate will monitor staff work progress, develop, and implement a preventative maintenance program, and maintain necessary records and reports of maintenance activity. He/she/them will supervise maintenance staff by establishing work priorities, approving, and enforcing work schedules, enforcing rules, standards, policies, and coordinating the activities performed by staff.


Supervision


Under the Assistant Director of Facilities, Maintenance Supervisor 1 will supervise subordinates and contractors visiting weekly. The titles of the positions supervised are Trades Specialist Carpenter, Trade Specialist Painter, Trades Specialist Electrician, Trades Specialist Plumber & Steamfitter, Maintenance Assistants, and Facilities Operations Assistants. This position will also oversee any contractor's onsite for scheduled work. Consisting of Plumbers, electricians, Fire alarm technicians, Elevator mechanics, Roofing contractors, and Building contractors. Coordination with the Supervising Janitor on the cleaning of project work areas. May supervise and provide technical direction to housekeeping staff.


**Job duties and responsibilities:**


**Plan and Oversee Maintenance Jobs**


* Review maintenance requests through the work order system and as required, visits the work/project site to confirm the nature and extent of maintenance requested and to determine dimensions, materials, equipment and labor required to complete the project
* Meet with supervisors involved to coordinate and schedule work to be performed
* Assign staff to the project, providing oral and written instructions.
* Observe and inspect projects in progress and when completed to ensure proper use of materials and equipment and that regulations and codes are followed and work is completed on a timely basis
* Consult with and advise supervisor on the feasibility and alternatives to proposed projects and equipment purchases.
* Coordinate with contractor's onsite- elevator Mechanics, exterminators, Fire Suppression contractors, Fire Extinguisher contractors, and Fire Alarm system contractors
* Conduct annual fire inspections with the Fire Inspector from the Office of Fire Prevention and Control


**Supervision and Training**


* Develop and implement training programs and record keeping based on observation of work performance. Delivery of training will be a coordination of internal and external providers
* Provide instructions and assistance in the solution of work-related problems and in the performance of specific tasks
* Evaluate the work performance of subordinate employees and take corrective action
* Implement and enforce safety procedures and standards for staff


**Budget**


* Prepare reports of estimates and actual costs for workforce, materials, and equipment for each project
* Assist in the preparation of the annual operating budget by recommending the budget requirements for the facility's maintenance programs, including staffing, materials and equipment needs
* Contractor/ Vendor procurement process ensuring best prices are given


**Work Request**


* Review work order requests to determine nature of the project, its appropriateness, feasibility, and priorities
* Schedule work and issue work orders
* Prepare and implement a preventative maintenance program
* Order or direct the ordering of materials and equipment


**Maintain computerized records**


* Work proficiently in computerized maintenance management systems, e-mail and other computer applications as assigned or required, i.e., campus keying system, Annual Inspections
* Annually prepares standardized written performance evaluations for subordinate employees

 **Job Requirements:** **Minimum Qualifications**


Non-competitive:


One year of trade experience subsequent to the completion of an apprenticeship or equivalent training and experience such as that required for: Trades Specialist (Carpenter), Trades Specialist (Electrician), Service & Repair Mechanic (Electronics), Trades Generalist, Grounds Construction Supervisor, Trades Specialist (Locksmith), Trades Specialist (Machinist), Trades Specialist (Mason & Plasterer), Service & Repair Mechanic (Motor Equipment), Trades Specialist (Painter), Trades Specialist (Plumber & Steamfitter), Service & Repair Mechanic (HVAC-R), Trades Specialist (Roofing), or Trades Specialist (Welder)

 **Additional Information:**  

Special Notes: This is a full time classified appointment. FLSA non-exempt position, that is, eligible for overtime. The hiring rate for the position is $54,860 annually, with an outstanding benefits package. For additional information please see the CSEA Benefits Summary.


Internal and external search to occur simultaneously.

title: Host/Hostess
description:
We are looking for an experienced Hosts that likes fast paced environments along with great energy!


We seek responsible, kind, hardworking individuals, with a positive and professional attitude and work-ethic. Our ideal candidates will bring genuine passion for service, hospitality, and enjoy working in a fast paced, high energy work environment.


This exciting Chelsea restaurant Shukette has been heralded by the NY Times for its "extroverted, generous spirit" and an approach to Middle Eastern Cooking that is "long overdue in New York." Led by Chef Ayesha Nurdjaja, a 2022 James Beard Award finalist for Best New Chef: New York, Shukette has been recognized as one of the top new restaurants in the city. Every night feels like a warm and breezy Summer evening at a cafe on the Mediterranean coast. Esoteric wines sourced from around the region and captivating fortified and aromatized cocktails round out our beverage program which perfectly complements the food.

* Greeting customers as they walk into the restaurant
* Helping guests with reservations and guiding them to their table
* Giving guests accurate wait time estimates
* Responsible for knowing restaurant and company information, including, but not limited to, hours of operations, directions, awareness of neighborhood, and sister properties.
* Be aware of regular guests/VIPs
* Organized and efficient
* Excellent communicator with the bar, service, kitchen and management staff.
* Understand all of the restaurants main dining room seating and configurations
* Understanding that we require a positive and professional attitude in the workplace

  

We offer


Paid Time Off


Transit Benefits


Dining Discounts


Shared Medical Plan


Soul Cycle Classes

  

This position requires daytime hours, evening hours and weekends with FULL and PART TIME AVAILABILITY.


Shukette provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

description:
Overview:
  

**Find Your Passion and Purpose as an Inpatient Hospice Clinical Liaison Registered Nurse RN**  

  

**Reimagine Your Career in Hospice**  

  

As a medical professional, you know that what you do impacts you as much as your patients and their families, and at AccentCare, we are united in our relentless drive to reimagine care because we want to provide the service we would seek for our own families. We think it's really special to be a part of our patient's health journey and create incredible memories while providing world-class patient care.  

  

**This is an onsite position at our partner hospital facility**  

  

**Choose your shift! 5-8's or 4-10's**  

  

**Every other weekend On-Call**  

  

**Full Benefits and Generous Compensation Package**  

  

**Must have a current New Jersey RN License**  

  

Offer Based on Years of Experience
  

What You Need to Know: **Our Investment in You**  

  

We are committed to offering comprehensive benefits and rewards to full-time employees who work over 30 hours per week and their families, including:
* **Medical, dental, and vision coverage**
* **Paid time off and paid holidays**
* **Professional development**
* **Company-matching 401(k)**
* **Flexible spending and health savings accounts**
* **Company store credit for your first AccentCare-branded scrubs for patient-facing employees**


Qualifications: **Be the Best Inpatient Hospice Clinical Liaison Registered Nurse RN You Can Be**  

  

If you meet these qualifications, we want to meet you!
  

* One (1) year of RN experience in local market with a strong knowledge of governmental home health regulations, Medicare requirements, and care plan development techniques
* Previous medical sales experience preferred

**Required Certifications and Licensures:**  

* Licensed RN currently licensed as a registered nurse in the state of agency operation
* Must be a licensed driver with an automobile that is insured and in accordance with state and/or organization requirements and in good working order

  

**Come As You Are**  

  

At AccentCare, our care is most compassionate when we empathize and engage with everyone, and we are at our best when we value diverse perspectives, foster open dialogue, and enact change. And we are stronger when each of us is empowered to grow, be our unique selves, and feel a sense of inclusion and belonging.  

  

AccentCare is proud of how we are building a culture and inclusive infrastructure to help elevate the voice of all our employees with a special focus on the underrepresented and marginalized. We offer equal employment opportunities regardless of a person's race, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, color, creed, age, mental disability, physical disability, or any other protected classification.

description:

Do you enjoy providing outstanding patient care? Bring your organizational skills and knowledge of at-home care and join the AccentCare team today in this Special Attendant job  

  

When you join AccentCare, you become part of a team that is not only dedicated to their patients, but to each other as well. Here, you will truly make a difference each and every day as you work alongside a supportive team. With a competitive benefits package, work-life balance, professional development, and an outstanding work environment, you will have everything you need to achieve success in your career. Join the AccentCare team and apply for this Special Attendant opportunity today!3

Hours: 9am - 5pm
  

Salary: $ 20.00/ Hr  

Office: Yonkers, NY  

  

Offer Based on Years of Experience
  

What You Need to Know:
  

**Special Attendant Responsibilities:**  

* Responsible for providing personal care assistance services to the client in accordance with the established service plan to enable the client to function in the home and community.
* Special Attendants are utilized to initiate services, prevent a break in service, and provide on-going service.
* Responsible for providing personal assistance services to the client in accordance with the established service plan to enable the client to function in the home and community.

Qualifications:
  

**Special Attendant Qualifications:**

* Bilingual (English & Spanish) preferred.
* At least 18 years of age.
* Must not be the parent of a minor child or spouse of client - on service with the agency
* Must have a valid driver's license and current automobile liability insurance. Must have reliable transportation.

title: Director - Finance, USCS Lending
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.

  



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.

  


Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.  


Our industry is rapidly evolving, and we need courageous, quick thinkers who can shape the strategic decisions that lead our business forward. Whether it’s negotiating with some of our largest global partners or creating next year’s financial plan, you can influence both our day-to-day P&L and the future direction of the company. As part of the team, you can have the opportunity to learn and use the latest data tools and technologies and explore a range of roles to grow your career. Find your place in finance on #TeamAmex.
**Director, USCS Lending & Customer Treatments**



The Director of USCS Lending & Customer Treatments is essential to the LFO organization and spearheads senior leadership level analyses focused on key Lending initiatives; Pay Over Time enhancements, APR Pricing strategies, Customer Level Pricing campaign analysis, credit line increase assessments, and Global Limits. Additionally, they provide strategic leadership on profitability assessments, lending economics, investment decisioning, lending portfolio health and monitoring, and P&L management. The Director will also perform ad-hoc analytics to unlock key financial insights helping to deliver on management’s expectations of USCS’s Lending financial and business plans.

  


The ideal candidate will have excellent analytical and organizational skills, strong quantitative and financial reasoning, clear and compelling communication, strong people leadership, and comfort with ambiguity. The candidate must be able to build solid, trust-based relationships with business partners and senior leaders that encourages candor and direct communication. **Responsibilities include:**
* Lead a team responsible for key Lending initiatives.


* Oversee deep, data-driven analytical efforts to unlock insights into sources of value creation in both the portfolio and overall business P&L.


* Build strong, trusting relationships with key business partners and senior leaders that encourage open and direct communication and dialogue.


* Lead, coach, train and develop a team with strong technical, financial and relationship skills.


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Strong strategic thinker – ability to integrate business strategy, financial thinking, competitive insight, consumer behavior and operational understanding.


* Excellent quantitative reasoning – ability to think through and drive a conversation using “quick math” in the moment.


* Very strong data analytics experience and ability to lead a team of data analytics experts to unlock insights.


* Exceptional relationship and collaboration skills, including the ability to work in a highly matrixed environment across product, marketing, and finance.


* Exemplary communication skills with the ability to break down complex ideas into understandable/actionable messages and tailor messages to non-technical audiences and senior leaders.


* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple, disparate workstreams concurrently without sacrificing quality.


* Leadership experience in a decision-support focused finance role.


* Track record of effectively coaching and developing colleagues.


* Bachelor’s Degree required, advanced degree in relevant field preferred.


Salary Range: $130,000.00 to $205,000.00 annually + bonus + equity (if applicable) + benefits



The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.



We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


* Competitive base salaries
* Bonus incentives
* 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
* Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
* Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
* Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
* 20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
* Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
* Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
* Career development and training opportunities


For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.



American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.



We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: IT Project Manager - Network Infrastructure
description:
**IT Project Manager - Network Infrastructure** - Princeton, NJ - 24-02507 **100% Remote W2 or C2C 6-months project**  

  

Company Overview: Req ID: 298124 NTT DATA strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now. NTT DATA's Client is seeking a IT Project Manager - Network Infrastructure to join their team in Princeton, New Jersey (US-NJ), United States (US). REMOTE  

  

Job Description: NTT DATA's Clients Project Management practice group is currently seeking a Sr IT Project Manager who has strong experience in IT Infrastructure server/storage and network implementation experience to support one of our global Healthcare devices/Life Science clients, based out of Princeton, NJ. In this role, the Sr IT Project Manager will be responsible to support the delivery of server and storage implementations by aligning to business requirements with internal and functional business groups to deliver initiatives, efficiency, and effectiveness in support of infrastructure, employee experience and cybersecurity. A successful candidate would leverage effective project management practices, working collaboratively with various divisions and cross functional teams while delivering cost-effective implementation exceeding stakeholder expectations. This position is a stakeholder facing role which requires the candidate to establish and manage expectations within the business and drive the team to achieve those expectations to a high standard.  

  

**Responsibilities and Duties:**
* Define infrastructure project scope, assess impact, determine implementation approach determine schedule, budget, resource needs working with various stakeholders.
* Server and Storage implementation space
* Network configuration
* Successfully lead complex projects to ensure business goals and objectives are Delivered.
* Deliver the assigned projects to successful conclusion (on time, on budget, and
* scope delivered).
* Follow defined project management framework and processes to execute projects.
* Ensuring compliance with all deliverables and stage gate reviews.
* Assist or lead the development of business requirements, solution design &
* delivery, testing and training.
* Lead the detailed planning and management of projects through to completion.
* Escalate, explain, and offer proactive solutions when risks/issues to projects are
* causing failure or inability to complete on time or budget.
* Continuously improve processes, tasks, and milestones using feedback and
* lessons learned as input into existing or future project plans.
* Maintain the appropriate metrics related to project activities and submit in
* accordance with required procedures.
* Coach, mentor, and motivate project team members and contractors, and
* influence them to take positive action and accountability for their assigned work.
* Maintain extensive knowledge and expertise in project management disciplines,
* as well as multiple business processes and/or technical areas.
* Present regularly to leadership on success of projects and program initiatives.
* Work with team members to spread project management standards and disciplines.
* Bridge gap between Network Service Delivery and Engineering teams for service delivery and steady state transition.


**Basic Qualifications**
* Minimum 7 years of experience as IT project manager with minimum 3 years' experience in Server/Storage Network projects
* Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, Information Technology or 10 years' experience in Information Technology projects.
* Certified in PMP methodologies preferred


**Preferred Experience and Skills:**
* Infrastructure Network configuration - Server and Storage implementations
* Strong familiarity with project management standards and methodologies including PMI Body of Knowledge.
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Ability to understand the final result and to translate that result into actionable steps
* Demonstrated conflict resolution skills
* Strong interpersonal and excellent documentation skills are a must
* Ability to explain and champion technical concepts to a broad audience
* Advanced knowledge in creating and maintaining management level and detailed project plans utilizing Microsoft products
* Excellent customer service skills required
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Able to work under pressure and meet deadlines
* Able to demonstrate a high degree of flexibility including shift and out of hours working
* Excellent organizational skills
* Self-motivation and able to take responsibility


**About NTT DATA**  

  

NTT DATA is a $30+ billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. We serve 75% of the Fortune Global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long-term success. As a Global Top Employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start-up companies. Our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure and connectivity. We are also one of the leading providers of digital and AI infrastructure in the world. NTT DATA is part of NTT Group, which invests over $3.6 billion each year in R&D to help organizations and society move confidently and sustainably into the digital future. Visit us at us.nttdata.com. Where required by law, NTT DATA provides a reasonable range of compensation for specific roles. The starting pay range for this role is **$60.11-$70/hour.** Actual compensation will depend on several factors, including the candidate's relevant experience, technical skills, and other qualifications. This position may also be eligible for incentive compensation based on individual and/or company performance.  

  

This position is eligible for company benefits including participation in medical, dental, and vision insurance, flexible spending or health savings account, and AD&D insurance, employee assistance, participation in a 401k program, and additional voluntary or legally-required benefits. NTT DATA is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regarding to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter so that we may connect you with the appropriate team.

title: Scheduling Coordinator
description:
The Mental Health Association is seeking **Licensed Clinicians**for our **new program,** **New Jersey Statewide Student Support Services (NJ4S) Hub**, operating in Morris and Sussex Counties.


The **NJ4S Hub program** will provide regional coverage through a “Hub” that will offer proven prevention strategies used to support every student in Morris and Sussex Counties and their families. The Hub will integrate its programming with existing state and local services, to improve coordination and reduce duplication of effort. The Hub will offer a tiered menu of evidence-based prevention and intervention strategies that can be deployed in high-need districts. The NJ4S Hub will provide universal supports to all Morris/Sussex students, and more intensive supports to students in schools with higher needs.


Qualified applicants for the position of **Scheduling Coordinator** will have, at minimum:

* **Associate's degree** in a related field (e.g. counseling, social work, etc.)
* Two (2) years of experience in scheduling and office management in community based services or social service setting.
* Additional education and related experience are preferred, such as bachelor’s degree in a human services related field. Applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute additional experience as indicated on a year-for-year basis with thirty (30) semester hour credits being equal to one (1) year of experience
* Demonstrates effective verbal and written **communication skills**.
* Computer literacy with some knowledge and experience in data entry, electronic medical records and Microsoft Office.
* Must be well-organized, accurate, have good interpersonal skills and welcome new ideas.
* Must be able to initiate and handle multiple tasks in a timely and accurate manner.


Under the direction of the Assistant Program Director, the **Scheduling Coordinator** will provide general support and be responsible for:


Answers general and new participant inquiries. Communicates with potential participants, supporting them with the scheduling and application process. Facilitates the paperwork process with potential participants. Coordinates inquiries with the NJ4S Assistant Director to ensure tiered services are provided accordingly. Schedules NJ4S prevention services with participants. Assists with scheduling and hosting NJ4S Advisory Group meetings. Assists with data collection and reporting as necessary. Coordinates and schedules NJ4S staff meetings. Participates in trainings as required. Perform other duties as assigned by the NJ4S Hub Assistant Director.

**Supervises:** Receptionist

**Reports to:** Assistant Program Director

  

#High


Fully paid medical coverage for eligible staff.  

Generous 401(k) match.  

Plentiful Paid Holidays, Vacation, Personal and Sick time.


MHAEM is a proud equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to attracting, retaining, and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is MHAEM’s policy to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
